reason: PARAMETER DOMAIN INCONSISTENCY BETWEEN ROOT AND CHILDREN: The root node states the model 'defines a one-parameter family of N=2 SUSY quantum mechanical models (q > 0 real)' and then separately introduces regime (III) at 'q = exp(2*pi*i/r) root of unity'. This creates an inconsistency: the parameter domain is stated as q > 0 real, but regime (III) has q = exp(2*pi*i/r) which is COMPLEX (|q| = 1, not real for r >= 3). The root node does not explain how the model extends from the stated domain q > 0 real to the complex unit circle. Nodes 1.1.1 (braided fermions) and 1.4.3 discuss this extension, but the root node's statement jumps between the real-q and root-of-unity regimes without acknowledging that they involve different domains of the parameter q and potentially different algebraic structures (finite-dimensional vs. truncated representations of U_q(su(2))).
